newsitem.title: USA: Spot US propane steady to high, data awaited.
newsitem.headline: Spot US propane steady to high, data awaited.

text.p: U.S. spot propane prices were steady to higher in thin trade late Wednesday ahead of Energy Information Administration data on stocks and retailer demand in the Midwest, players said.
EIA data is to be released later Wednesday and many players said they were expecting a draw.
In the Midwest, spot propane had a day of jumpy activity, trading in the morning at 72.25 cents and then later at 81.50 cents. The latest deal was in the mid-79.00 cent range.
"It's been all over the place," said one Conway player, adding "a couple of retailers have been in the market snooping."
In general, many retailers have held off on buying barrels for winter heating storage in anticipation that high prices seen throughout the summer and fall will come down.
Meanwhile, sagging NYMEX crude oil futures kept a lid on prices in the U.S. Gulf Coast, where trade was very thin.
Mont Belvieu, Texas, spot propane held steady between 54.25 cents and 54.75 cents a gallon, about two cents below Tuesday.
The lower propane prices took down ethane, which was in the 36.00 range in late trade.
-- Laney Salisbury, New York Energy Desk, 212 859-1631
